result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Douglas R Fleury was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
Must pay $50.00 per month toward restitution beginning on 8/1/15.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Defendant Douglas R Fleury in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:18 14CF74, 14TR276 and 14TR277 called.  State recites agreement.  Attorney Hinde relates.  State and Defense agree to waive PSI.   Court questions Defendant.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 OWI 5th Offense.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Count 2, 14TR276 and 14TR277 are Dismissed.  State relates.  C-31 and VIS filed.  Attorney Hinde relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 3 years Probation
$600 fine plus costs
1 year jail - Huber and good time granted - Credit for 1 day - Report to jail by 3:00 PM today
36 month DL revocation
Ignition interlock 36 months
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
$500.00 restitution - Must pay $50.00 per month beginning 8/1/15 toward restitution
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent

Voting rights and firearm warning given.
